revised_title: The Controversy and Election of the Royal Society Presidency in 1820
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
tldr: This article discusses the events surrounding the election of the Royal Society's presidency in 1820. It highlights the controversy between Humphry Davy and William Wollaston, as well as the involvement of Joseph Banks. The author provides a detailed account of the political maneuvering and public intervention that took place during the election process.
